qas.question: How many mg of fat is suggested for a healthy person's diet?
What percentage of mono-polyunsaturated fat should make up a person's daily energy requirements?
What is a good replacement for olive oil?
Nutritionists recommend an intake of more than 30% of what in one's diet?

plausible_answers.text: the effect of dietary fat on the development of cardiovascular disease

qas.question: What controversy have dieticians largely settled?

context: There is some controversy surrounding <b4_0>the effect of dietary fat on the development of cardiovascular disease<b4_0/>. People are often advised to keep a diet where less than <b1_0>30%<b1_0/> of the energy intake derives from <b3_0>fat<b3_0/>, a diet that contains less than 7% of the energy intake in the form of saturated fat, and a diet that contains <b0_0>less than 300 mg/day<b0_0/> of cholesterol. Replacing saturated with mono- polyunsaturated fat is also recommended, as the consumption of polyunsaturated fat instead of saturated fat may decrease coronary heart disease. Olive oil, rapeseed oil and related products are to be used instead of <b2_0>saturated<b2_0/> fat.
